info.title: Schema of Storage events published to Azure Event Grid
info.description: Describes the schema of the Storage events published to Azure Event Grid. This corresponds to the Data property of an EventGridEvent.

api.description: The name of the API/operation that triggered this event.

clientRequestId.description: A request id provided by the client of the storage API operation that triggered this event.

requestId.description: The request id generated by the Storage service for the storage API operation that triggered this event.

sequencer.description: An opaque string value representing the logical sequence of events for any particular  name. Users can use standard string comparison to understand the relative sequence of two events on the same  name.

identity.description: The identity of the requester that triggered this event.

storageDiagnostics.description: For service use only. Diagnostic data occasionally included by the Azure Storage service. This property should be ignored by event consumers.

contentLength.description: The size of the blob in bytes. This is the same as what would be returned in the Content-Length header from the blob.

contentType.description: The content type of the blob. This is the same as what would be returned in the Content-Type header from the blob.

StorageAsyncOperationInitiatedEventData.description: Schema of the Data property of an EventGridEvent for a Microsoft.Storage.AsyncOperationInitiated event.

eTag.description: The etag of the blob at the time this event was triggered.

contentOffset.description: The offset of the blob in bytes.

api.description: The name of the API/operation that triggered this event.

clientRequestId.description: A request id provided by the client of the storage API operation that triggered this event.

requestId.description: The request id generated by the Storage service for the storage API operation that triggered this event.

sequencer.description: An opaque string value representing the logical sequence of events for any particular  name. Users can use standard string comparison to understand the relative sequence of two events on the same  name.

identity.description: The identity of the requester that triggered this event.

contentType.description: The content type of the blob. This is the same as what would be returned in the Content-Type header from the blob.

contentType.description: The content type of the blob. This is the same as what would be returned in the Content-Type header from the blob.

StorageBlobDeletedEventData.description: Schema of the Data property of an EventGridEvent for a Microsoft.Storage.BlobDeleted event.

scheduleDateTime.description: The time at which inventory policy was scheduled.

accountName.description: The account name for which inventory policy is registered.

ruleName.description: The rule name for inventory policy.

policyRunStatus.description: The status of inventory run, it can be Succeeded/PartiallySucceeded/Failed.

policyRunStatusMessage.description: The status message for inventory run.

policyRunId.description: The policy run id for inventory run.

manifestBlobUrl.description: The blob URL for manifest file for inventory run.

StorageBlobInventoryPolicyCompletedEvent.description: Schema of the Data property of an EventGridEvent for an Microsoft.Storage.BlobInventoryPolicyCompleted event.

sourceUrl.description: The path to the blob that was renamed.

destinationUrl.description: The new path to the blob after the rename operation.

url.description: The path to the deleted directory.

totalObjectsCount.description: Total number of objects to be acted on by this action.

successCount.description: Number of success operations of this action.

errorList.description: Error messages of this action if any.

StorageLifecyclePolicyActionSummaryDetai.description: Execution statistics of a specific policy action in a Blob Management cycle.

scheduleTime.description: The time the policy task was scheduled.

deleteSummary.description: Execution statistics of a specific policy action in a Blob Management cycle.

tierToCoolSummary.description: Execution statistics of a specific policy action in a Blob Management cycle.

tierToArchiveSummary.description: Execution statistics of a specific policy action in a Blob Management cycle.

StorageLifecyclePolicyCompletedEventData.description: Schema of the Data property of an EventGridEvent for a Microsoft.Storage.LifecyclePolicyCompleted event.

eventSubscriptionId.description: The Azure resource ID of the deleted event subscription.

StorageLifecyclePolicyCompletedEventData.description: Schema of the Data property of an EventGridEvent for a Microsoft.EventGrid.SubscriptionDeletedEvent event.

validationCode.description: The validation code sent by Azure Event Grid to validate an event subscription. To complete the validation handshake, the subscriber must either respond with this validation code as part of the validation response, or perform a GET request on the validationUrl (available starting version 2018-05-01-preview).

validationUrl.description: The validation URL sent by Azure Event Grid (available starting version 2018-05-01-preview). To complete the validation handshake, the subscriber must either respond with the validationCode as part of the validation response, or perform a GET request on the validationUrl (available starting version 2018-05-01-preview).

StorageLifecyclePolicyCompletedEventData.description: Schema of the Data property of an EventGridEvent for a Microsoft.EventGrid.SubscriptionValidationEvent event.

validationResponse.description: The validation response sent by the subscriber to Azure Event Grid to complete the validation of an event subscription.

StorageLifecyclePolicyCompletedEventData.description: To complete an event subscription validation handshake, a subscriber can use either the validationCode or the validationUrl received in a SubscriptionValidationEvent. When the validationCode is used, the SubscriptionValidationResponse can be used to build the response.
